answerText: The Mayor of Zalamea [or El alcalde de Zalamea]  [10] Also written by the author of The Mayor of Zalamea was this play, in which Don Gutierre has his wife Doña Mercia bled to death because she keeps flirting with her ex-lover, Prince Enrique.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Los Angeles B and Iowa | 13 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: It concludes with King Philip II arriving in town and, after chiding the title character, appointing him to the title position for the rest of his life.   [10] Identify this play in which Pedro Crespo imprisons Don Alvaro for raping his daughter Isabel, only to have Alvaro mysteriously strangled while behind bars.
